My proposed solution:
Make the Password and Confirm Password fields optional when creating a user.
Set the Confirm Password field as mandatory only if a password is entered in the Password field.
Update the frontend to reflect the new backend changes and ensure smooth integration.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10959
activity.text:
Hii @nihal467 I want to work on this issue can you assign it to me? 
My proposed solution:

- Create New User & Setup Test Environment:
Register a new user on the platform by calling the dev backend API and update the Cypress fixture with the new user ID.
Create the test file patient_department.cy.ts and a related object file for reusable elements.

- Test-1: Department and Sub-department Creation & Search:
Navigate to the "Add Department" section, create a department and sub-department.
Verify the department and sub-department using the dashboard search functionality.

- Test-2: Link User to Facility:
Navigate to the facility's administration department and link the newly created user to the facility.
Verify the user is successfully linked by checking the department’s user list.

- Test-3: Assign Patient to New Department in Encounter:

Open a live encounter, assign the patient to the newly created department in the "Manage Organization" section.
Verify that the patient is successfully assigned to the organization.

EOD 16/03/25

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11211
activity.text:
@nihal467  @rithviknishad  I want to work on this can you assign it to me? 
My proposed solution:
If the dropdown list is empty, display a "+" icon within the dropdown.
When the "+" icon is clicked, trigger the createTag function to allow users to add a new tag dynamically.
After the new tag is successfully created, update the dropdown with the newly added tag in real-time, without requiring a page refresh.  

ETA  Tomorrow

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10924
activity.text:
@rithviknishad 

1) Integrate the i18n-unused library to scan and remove unused i18n keys from public/locale/{locale}.json.

2) Create an npm script (npm run i18n:cleanup) to run the cleanup process.

3) Add the cleanup command to the existing .husky/pre-commit file to automate the cleanup before every commit.

 4) Ensure the translation files are automatically cleaned up with every commit.
